com.gensym.jgi
Interface G2ConnectionListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
G2ConnectionAdapter
public interface G2ConnectionListener
extends EventListener

A G2ConnectionListener is informed when any of the following events occur;

  • The connected G2 has resumed.
  • The connected G2 has paused.
  • The connected G2 has send a message.
  • The connection to G2 has been closed.
  • A connection to G2 has just been established.
  • A communicationError has occured while the connection to a G2 is active.
  • A communication error has occured, but no connection is active.
  • The network cannot deliver data that Java is attempting to write to G2.
  • The network cannot deliver data that G2 is attempting to write to Java.

    Method Detail

    g2IsPaused

    public void g2IsPaused(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called whenever the connected G2 process pauses its current knowledge base (KB).

    g2isPaused() is useful for pausing any methods/threads that operate asynchronously to G2. You can use g2isPaused() to suspend these functions until G2 resumes operation.

    g2IsResumed

    public void g2IsResumed(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called when a connected G2 process resumes its current knowledge base (KB).

    g2isResumed is called when the connected G2 process resumes running its current knowledge base(KB). If a listener has any asynchronous operations that are suspended by a call to g2isPaused(), you can include code in g2isResumed() to resume those operations.

    g2IsReset

    public void g2IsReset(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called whenever the connected G2 process resets its current knowledge base (KB).

    g2isReset() is useful for pausing any methods/threads that operate asynchronously to G2. You can use g2isReset() to suspend these functions until G2 resumes operation.

    g2IsStarted

    public void g2IsStarted(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called whenever the connected G2 process starts its current knowledge base (KB).

    g2isStarted() is useful for starting any methods/threads that operate asynchronously to G2.

    g2ConnectionClosed

    public void g2ConnectionClosed(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called when a connected G2 closes an active connection.

    g2ConnectionClosed()is called when:

  • The connected G2 process disables, deactivates, or deletes the GSI Interface
  • The connected G2 process changes the text of the GSI-CONNECTION-CONFIGURATION attribute of the G2 GSI-INTERFACE that is connected to a G2Gateway.
  • When the connected G2 is reset.
  • When a network error or failure causes the connection to the G2 process to be lost.

    Do not try to send data to G2 or invoke any G2 procedures from this method. By the time G2ConnectionClosed() is called, G2 has already closed the network connection, or the connection has been lost due to a network failure.

    • g2ConnectionInitialized

    public void g2ConnectionInitialized(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called when a G2 process has just initiated a connection.

    G2 calls g2ConnectionInitialized each time you activate a G2 connection that specifies the machine name and port number on which a G2Connection instance is listening. It can also be called as a result of calling G2Gateway methods initiateConnection or getOrMakeConnection

    You can use this callback to perform tasks such as:

  • Validating connections from G2, as for a login procedure.
  • Allocating and/or initializing global tables on a per connection basis; that is, tables which are unique to this connection.
  • Declaring G2 procedures as remote procedures, so the G2Gateway can access them. These remote procedure declarations are valid only for the lifetime of the connection with G2. The string entered in the remote-process-initialization-string attribute of the G2 GSI-INTERFACE object that caused the connection to occur can be accessed by calling event.getMessage()
    Parameters:
    event - The G2ConnectionEvent created for this event.

    • g2MessageReceived

    public void g2MessageReceived(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called when G2 sends a message to the G2Connection.

    g2MessageReceived() is called when a G2Gateway receives a message from a connected G2. G2 can sent a message by executing an inform action on a GSI-INTERFACE that is configured as a GSI message server. The Message sent from g2 is embedded with the G2ConnectionEvent and can be accessed by calling event.getMessage().

    Parameters:
    event - The G2ConnectionEvent created for this event.

    communicationError

    public void communicationError(G2CommunicationErrorEvent error_event)
    Called when an asynchronous error has occured in the G2 communications interface for the G2Connection
    Parameters:
    error_event - An G2CommunicationErrorEvent describing the error that occured.

    readBlockage

    public void readBlockage(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called when the network cannot deliver data that Java is attempting to write to G2.

    event.getstate will return; true - The network cannot deliver data, false - The network can now deliver data once again

    Parameters:
    event - The G2ConnectionEvent created for this event.

    writeBlockage

    public void writeBlockage(G2ConnectionEvent event)
    Called when the network cannot deliver data that G2 is attempting to write to Java.

    event.getState will return true - The network cannot deilver data, false - The network can now deliver data once again

    Parameters:
    event - The G2ConnectionEvent created for this event.
